newsitem.title: UK: Railtrack hits new peak in stock shortage.
newsitem.headline: Railtrack hits new peak in stock shortage.

text.p: Shares in Railtrack Plc rose to a record high on Thursday as a large buyer of the stock left market makers short, dealers said. "Someone took out half a million Railtrack shares and that caught the market unawares," said one dealer.

The stock, still trading in partly-paid form after last year's privatisation, was up 15p at 419 by 1253 GMT in active trade of 5.6 million shares. Earlier it rose as high as 429p -- surpassing the previous peak of 405p set December 20.
"There has been some very very good buying and a lot of the market has been very squeezed," said one market maker.
The rail industry regulator on Thursday repeated its call for Railtrack to spend more on improving the UK's rail network.
But dealers said the statement did not appear to contain anything that had not been said before.
Railtrack shares have powered ahead in recent weeks, driven by a series of positive factors including hopes for a revaluation of its property portfolio.
